title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: The river Tarf has to be forded, but in ordinary summer weather it is not more than fourteen inches

title: John Splendid;
author: Munro, Neil
snippet: It was with the repartee of the Irish and the scowls of the Gaels we went up the rough valley of the Tarf, where the wind moaned most drearily and drove the thin fine snow like a smoke of burning  heather.

title: John Splendid;
author: Munro, Neil
snippet: troopers, swanky blaspheming persons, whose horses pranced very gaily up Glen Tarf, guided by John Lorn.
